page.title: 01The Beswick Area
page.content: The village of{Beswick}is situated on the A164 midway between the towns of Beverley and Driffield. The main road at one time ran through the village but about 1966 a new section of road was built to by-pass the village. The area under survey extends to the north and east of the village of {Lockington,}reaching the most southerly parts of the village of {Watton.}The A164 and the Hull-Bridlington railway line, both running north-south, divide the area roughly into thirds vertically. {Beswick}village is the main centre of habitation within this survey region. There are very minor communities at Kilnwick Lodges and at the southern extremes of Watton. Other than these, the only remaining dwellings are isolated farmsteads.
